labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: type:bug :bug:
labels.description: Inconsistencies or issues which will cause an issue or problem for users or implementors.

items.body:
<!-- THIS INFORMATION IS MANDATORY - YOUR ISSUE WILL BE CLOSED IF IT IS MISSING. If you don't know your Rasa version, use `rasa --version`. 
Please format any code or console output with three ticks ``` above and below.
If you are asking a usage question (e.g. "How do I do xyz") please post your question on https://forum.rasa.com instead -->

**Rasa version**: 1.10.2

**Rasa SDK version** (if used & relevant): 1.10.0

**Rasa X version** (if used & relevant): 0.29.1

**Python version**: 3.7

**Operating system** (windows, osx, ...): Linux

**Issue**:
An issue I ran into when following the [documentation instructions to build my own action server image](https://rasa.com/docs/rasa/user-guide/how-to-deploy/#building-an-action-server-image) was that I was receiving errors due to the default `rasa/rasa-sdk` start command.  Developers should know that if they wanted to have a module with their actions code (as is mentioned in the preceding steps), they should change their start command to `rasa-sdk start --actions actions` or the like, since rasa/rasa-sdk will have the default `rasa-sdk start --actions actions.actions` start command.

Documentation should reflect the need for that change.

```

```

```

items.title: rasa data split nlu: test data should contain at least one example for every label

labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: type:enhancement :sparkles:
labels.description: Additions of new features or changes to existing ones, should be doable in a single PR

items.body:
**Description of Problem**:
When we split NLU data via `rasa data split nlu` it might happen that the test data does not contain any examples for some response labels. 
(related to https://github.com/RasaHQ/rasa/pull/6013)

**Overview of the Solution**:
Make sure to include at least one example per response label in the test data when splitting the data via `rasa data split nlu`.

The entity is extracted correctly as Paris(location) and the slot(for location) is also filled . What could be causing this error given that the entity is correctly extracted ?

**Content of actions.py** : 
```
from rasa_sdk import Action
from rasa_sdk.events import SlotSet

class ActionWeather(Action):
    def name(self):
        return 'action_weather'
    def run(self,dispatcher,tracker,domain):
        from apixu.client import ApixuClient
        api_key = '*****'
        client = ApixuClient(api_key)
        
        loc = tracker.get_slot('location')
        current = client.current(q=loc)
        
        country = current['location']['country']
        city = current['location']['name']
        condition = current['current']['condition']['text']
        temperature_c = current['current']['temp_c']
        humidity = current['current']['humidity']
        wind_mph = current['current']['wind_mph']
        
        response =""" It is currently {} in {} at the moment . The temperature is {} degrees,the humidity is {}% and the wind speed is {} mph.""".format(condition,city,temperature_c,humidity,wind_mph)
        
        dispatcher.utter_message(response)
        return [SlotSet('location',loc)]
    

```

What could be causing this error ? Please help me . Thanks

items.title: RulePolicy: scope dispatches per form

labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: Impacts a high number of users. Prevents using a core feature normally or secondary feature at all

labels.name: type:enhancement :sparkles:
labels.description: Additions of new features or changes to existing ones, should be doable in a single PR

items.body:
**Current State**
As part of the `RulePolicy` we moved the `FormAction` from the Rasa SDK to Rasa Open Source. 
Whenever we request a slot, we currently dispatch an utterance to ask for this slot (see [here](https://github.com/RasaHQ/rasa/blob/da148ae98cbd0c03c8c5a48161622f700e15ec22/rasa/core/actions/forms.py#L476)). The utterance follows the template `utter_ask_<slot name>`.
The problem is that if a slot is part of multiple forms, we always use the same utterance to ask for the slot although the slot might have slightly different meanings in the form.

**Proposed Changes**
* Check if there is a `utter_ask_<form_name>_<slot_name>` in the `domain`. If yes, dispatch it. If no, dispatch `utter_ask_<slot_name>`

items.title: RulePolicy: Have one `validate_form` function instead of multiple ones

labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: Impacts a high number of users. Prevents using a core feature normally or secondary feature at all

labels.name: type:enhancement :sparkles:
labels.description: Additions of new features or changes to existing ones, should be doable in a single PR

items.body:
**Current State**
As part of the `RulePolicy` we moved the `FormAction` to Rasa Open Source. The form logic is now inside Rasa Open Source. The slot validation can be overwritten by adding custom actions with the syntax `validate_<slot name>` ([see this part of the code](https://github.com/RasaHQ/rasa/blob/da148ae98cbd0c03c8c5a48161622f700e15ec22/rasa/core/actions/forms.py#L390)) . The custom validation function currently receives a temporary tracker which means it's the current conversation + any new `SlotSet` events. 

**Proposed Changes**
- [x] have one function `action_validate_<form_name` to validate everything. `action_validate_<form_name` can also be used to apply custom slot mappings. This means whatever slots they set, they set.
- [x] Change the temporary tracker which we send to this action so that it is clear which slots were extracted previously. This means we send `[*old_tracker_events, ActionExecuted(<form name>), - - [ ] extracted slots)
- [x] Currently we return a `ActionExecutedRejection` event if no new potential slot values were found (see [here](https://github.com/RasaHQ/rasa/blob/da148ae98cbd0c03c8c5a48161622f700e15ec22/rasa/core/actions/forms.py#L436)). As users can now implement their custom slot mappings as part of the `action_validate_<form_name` we need to change the logic. We now should return a `ActionExecutedRejection` when
  * no new slots were extracted **and**
  * `action_validate_<form_name` did neither return a `SlotSet` event nor a bot response

items.title: RulePolicy: Implement new Form featurization

labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: Impacts a high number of users. Prevents using a core feature normally or secondary feature at all

labels.name: type:enhancement :sparkles:
labels.description: Additions of new features or changes to existing ones, should be doable in a single PR

items.body:
The happy path of a form should represented by a single `Form` event in order to simplify featurization:


```
[ ACTION_LISTEN, 
  intent_which_triggers_form,
  FormEvent <- this could be multiple user messages, Actions, etc
  SlotSetEvents
  ACTION_LISTEN
  next_intent
]
```

Unhappy path:

```
[ ACTION_LISTEN, 
  intent_which_triggers_form,
  FormEvent <- this could be multiple user messages, Actions, etc
  ACTION_LISTEN
  SomeUnhappyIntent
  FormEvent
] 
```

The necessary logic should be implemented in `DialogueStateTracker.applied_events()`

items.title: Whitespace Tokenizer incorrectly removes vowel signs for text in Hindi

labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: type:bug :bug:
labels.description: Inconsistencies or issues which will cause an issue or problem for users or implementors.

items.body:
**Rasa version**: master

**Python version**: 3.6.5

**Operating system** (windows, osx, ...): osx

**Issue**:
`WhitespaceTokenizer.tokenize` tries to remove punctuations/symbols using a regex - 
```
words = re.sub(
            # there is a space or an end of a string after it
            r"[^\w#@&]+(?=\s|$)|"
            # there is a space or beginning of a string before it
            # not followed by a number
            r"(\s|^)[^\w#@&]+(?=[^0-9\s])|"
            # not in between numbers and not . or @ or & or - or #
            # e.g. 10'000.00 or blabla@gmail.com
            # and not url characters
            r"(?<=[^0-9\s])[^\w._~:/?#\[\]()@!$&*+,;=-]+(?=[^0-9\s])",
            " ",
            text,
        ).split()
```
This regex cleans up all vowel signs which is wrong.

Example input: `50 क्या आपके पास डेरी मिल्क 10 वाले बॉक्स मिल सकते है`
Ideally, the whitespace tokenizer should give the following list of tokens:
```
['50', 'क्या', 'आपके', 'पास', 'डेरी', 'मिल्क', '10', 'वाले', 'बॉक्स', 'मिल', 'सकते', 'है']
```
instead, the tokens returned are:
```
['50', 'क', 'य', 'आपक', 'प', 'स', 'ड', 'र', 'म', 'ल', 'क', '10', 'व', 'ल', 'ब', 'क', 'स', 'म', 'ल', 'सकत', 'ह']
```
This also leads to misaligned entity annotations as described [here](https://forum.rasa.com/t/hindi-entity-extraction-tokenizer-issue/29951).

items.title: Current version not infering entities in a string without whitespaces, ignoring the different tokens provided

labels.name: area:rasa-oss :ferris_wheel:
labels.description: Anything related to the open source Rasa framework

labels.name: type:bug :bug:
labels.description: Inconsistencies or issues which will cause an issue or problem for users or implementors.

items.body:
<!-- THIS INFORMATION IS MANDATORY - YOUR ISSUE WILL BE CLOSED IF IT IS MISSING. If you don't know your Rasa version, use `rasa --version`. 
Please format any code or console output with three ticks ``` above and below.
If you are asking a usage question (e.g. "How do I do xyz") please post your question on https://forum.rasa.com instead -->

**Rasa version**: 
1.10.2

**Python version**: 
3.7.3

**Operating system** (windows, osx, ...): 
Windows 10

**Issue**:
NLU models now don't infer correctly two entities that are part of a same string but without whitespaces, even if I guarantee that the two entities are two distinct tokens. This makes NER tasks less flexible and it was something that it was working fine on Rasa 1.9.7 (I did a downgrade to have this back working).

For example, the model can't infer a currency entity with value '$' if the sentence is something like 'it was $50'. Also, it can't infer month (MM) and day (DD) in separate entities if the date is presented as in '11-19-2020'. These patterns work just fine on Rasa 1.9.7.

Spacy tokenizer does creates separate tokens for the '-' character, as can be checked in the following Python code:
```py
import spacy
nlp = spacy.load('en_core_web_md')
doc = nlp('it was on 10-05-2020')

for i in range(len(doc)):
    print(doc[i])
```

The problem on the bot can be reproduced on rasa shell using the following nlu.md for training:
```md
## intent:inform_date
- its [10](MM)-[05](DD)
- today is [05](DD) of [january](month)
- yes it was [7](DD) of [june](month)
- [15](DD) of [december](month)
- it was [01](MM)-[02](DD)
- I did it at [10](MM)-[25](DD)-[2019](YYYY)
- it was [05](MM)-[01](DD)-[2020](YYYY)
- [02](MM)-[03](DD)-[2020](YYYY)

## intent:inform_value
- [$](currency)[40](value)
- [$](currency)[120](value)
- [$](currency) [10](value)
- [500.00](value)
- [20.00](value)
- it was [$](currency)[40.50](value)
```




**Error (including full traceback)**:
```
On rasa shell nlu, enter:
'it was $50.00'

There will be no entities infered for '$' and '50.00'.
```

**Command or request that led to error**:
```
On rasa shell nlu, enter:
'it was $50.00'

There will be no entities infered for '$' and '50.00'.
```

**Content of configuration file (config.yml)** (if relevant):
```yml
language: en_core_web_md
pipeline:
  - name: SpacyNLP
  - name: SpacyTokenizer
  - name: RegexFeaturizer
  - name: LexicalSyntacticFeaturizer
  - name: CountVectorsFeaturizer
  - name: CountVectorsFeaturizer
    analyzer: "char_wb"
    min_ngram: 1
    max_ngram: 4
  - name: DIETClassifier
    epochs: 100
  - name: EntitySynonymMapper
  - name: ResponseSelector
    epochs: 100
```
